name: ITP A1196-5 - Miscellaneous Steel Works
Sequence of Works
Confirm correct quantities/materials delivered to site
Install all materials in accordance with shop drawings or approved design engineering
All fixings installed as per shop drawings
Includes screw, nuts, bolts, rivets, washers, fixing anchors, supporting members, hangers, bracings, brackets, straps
All metalworks installed flush and level in accordance with specification tolerance
All paint or metal finishing in good condition without any damage on the surface
Final Inspection & Handover
Final site walk to confirm satisfactory installed
All defects closed out. Required information for warranty & certification has been submitted
Attach installer signature
I confirm that all necessary inspections have been carried out and can verify that the work has been completed and conforms to the contract specification.
Balustrade / Steel Structures Installation
Preliminaries
Verify applicable shop drawings required for work area.
Check incoming materials:
No handling damages. Complies with applicable shop drawings
Quantity
Correct mark no.
No handling damage
Site Assembly
Install the steel members as per the shop drawings.
Check erected steelwork:
AS4100 - 15.3 Tolerances – Column bases alignment: Position in plan +/-6mm, level +/-10mm.
Beam is within +/-10 of its correct level at connections to other members.
Orientation
Position
Plumbness
Squareness
Level
Ensure correct bolts, nut and washers to design drawings sizes and type.
Check tightening of bolts as per specification.
Check for the threaded portion of the bolt
Threaded portion of the bolt projects through the nut for a minimum of two (2) threads and a maximum of 10mm when fully tightened
Grouting of base plates
All grout under base plates shall be Conbextra GP free-flow non- shrink cementitious grout (U.N.O) or equivalent with Minimum compressive strength of 50MPa
Three (3) 75 mm test cubes shall be taken from the first batch of material mixed, then three (3) 75 mm cubes for every 100 kg of material used.
Test cubes shall be made in rigid steel molds
Check if coatings damaged during erection.
